file_content.text: This planet unnerves me. I sense such suffering here.
I've never seen destruction on this scale before. It's almost beautiful. Like sculpture.
Death has been here. She is merciless.
The Empire really destroyed this place, huh. I mean, you'd think in a few centuries, the Republic would've rebuilt something.
So this is what happens to a planet when the Empire's through. Something to think about.
Taris must have been glorious... a long time ago. We will dream of it.
I've never seen so much... destruction. Even on Balmorra.
I knew some folks who were smuggling relics off this giant landfill... wonder if they bugged out yet.
Watch your step--one false move and you're going to need a major bath.
We should proceed cautiously--it would be difficult to plan a retreat from here.
More toxic chemicals for you to wade in, my master.
Junk looks caustic. Reminds me of this one Hutt who used to joke about teaching his enemies to swim. In acid.
Buddy of mine used to use chemical spills to punish people--he'd hang them upside down above a wreck, make them breathe the fumes. Kept them in line.
Death in water. It is an unfortunate thing to happen to a planet.
Something tells me we don't want to go for a swim. I hope all the water here isn't that toxic.
Care to take a dip? I'm sure a chemical peel would do wonders for your complexion.
Sure hope this place is airtight--that gas cannot be healthy.
ChemWorks plant of some sort. Looks vile.
Reminds me of the air on Urkupp.
Care to place a bet on whether that stuff's safe to breathe?
Let's not stick around, okay? I like my lungs the way they are.
We visited the industrial plants on Fest, once. The toxic zones were much like this; so many workers were sick.
This can't be healthy. I think my next investment is going to be a top-of-the-line rebreather.
I don't know if this gas is poisonous, but I do know I'm never going to get the smell out of these clothes.
The skeleton of a rather large beast. Luckily, I believe it's extinct.
This doesn't exactly make me feel welcome. But I suppose that is the intent.
Only bones. A shame. It's been too long since I've been tested.
Big fella. I hope the Empire's bombs killed him and not something bigger.
Yeah... I've seen critters that big, giant things, and they don't live on a planet like this. They just... don't.
The nest can strip a creature that size down to bone in minutes. But it takes an entire nest.
You don't think whatever owned those bones was alive when Taris fell, do you?
Well, at least the wildlife is smaller these days.
I have a sneaking suspicion we're going to be up to our necks in those rakghoul things.
I feel a strange kinship with these nekghouls. But it's still fun to watch them die.
These creatures taste of Sith.
Rakghouls, nekghouls, whatever you call 'em, they still die.
What is that stink? That's not just rakghouls, that's gotta be something else.
There is no natural life here. What we smell is... wrong.
This place is in pretty good shape... comparatively.
I say we just cave in the entrance and call it a day, what do you say?
The Endar Spire, my lord. The destruction of this ship was legendary. It set in motion the series of events that led to Darth Malak's bombardment of the planet.
The Endar Spire. I remember studying it in school. Those who didn't die in the crash were killed when Darth Malak destroyed the surface.
The great Tulak Hord once pulled a ship this size from the sky.
The Endar Spire! Ship's a legend. Mostly because the Empire shot it down, but still. Never thought I'd see it in person.
Bad way to die, crashing a ship into a planet. There're worse ways, though; suppose it doesn't hurt.
We recall that ship from the histories. A Republic vessel, brought down by Darth Malak.
I think that's the Endar Spire. It got shot down just before Taris got sacked. Can't think of any other ship it could be.
There's the Endar Spire. Lot of history attached to that ship. I've heard that if it had never been here, Taris would still be standing.
My father always said, "Never bite off more than you can chew." Well, I like to think he would have, anyway.
It's humbling to know and hard to imagine that this place was once a bustling metropolis.
Unfinished or ruined, there is no difference.
I'm guessing they started that before this place got blown to pieces. 'Cause this sure is a strange place to build a high-rise.
Some people can't take a lesson. You build something like that, you're asking to get it torn down.
Strange, to see something new here. A flower blooming among metal skeletons.
That's all new construction over there. The Republic were really starting to make some progress. Shame.
I don't see why the Republic bothered with all this construction. What's this place have to offer beyond a miserable life and a miserable death?
This is an excellent staging site. Easily defended and built for quick mobilization.
It's a good day for a maiming. Let's get what we need here and move on to where the action is.
The Empire will overrun this planet.
Doesn't take long for the Empire to settle in, build a base, set up some really big guns. You guys really take your destruction seriously.
Reporting in, sir! Rakghoul stole my helmet, sir, scared me white!
The Diplomatic Service sometimes sends people to the front line to negotiate a surrender or a treaty. We always admire the soldiers stationed in places like these.
The Empire's already taken a base out here? They're really pushing hard.
Looks like this used to be a Republic outpost. The Imperials are really cleaning the place out.
Since it's just you and me, I can safely say, I don't like this "attacking the Jedi" one bit.
It's time to spill Jedi blood. Look, I'm getting goose bumps.
I hope there are many Jedi inside.
Thought I was done seeing the insides of Republic spaceports a long time ago.
Look, this planet is a mess and I need a drink. Let's do what we have to and wrap this up.
We are deep within the hive of the enemy. We should be cautious.
This spaceport's the Republic's lifeline to Taris. It'll be where they make their last stand. Let's be careful.
If the Empire's pushed the Republic all the way back to the spaceport, then they're on their last legs now.
The guts of the dead city.
Place has a creepy kind of vibe, huh. I mean, who knows what could've moved in here since the planet was destroyed.
Used to sneak around in the transport stations on Brentaal. High-traffic hours, you could really mess people up.
There are alien scents here. Beings not from Taris.
Looks like some kind of transit system. I doubt it still functions, but it looks like it held up to the destruction pretty well.
Looks like a train station, or something. Is it too much to hope we can catch a ride?
Did I ever mention I have a fear of dying from radiation exposure?
This is our only lead for finding General Frellka. I hope Lieutenant Pierce's intel is reliable.
Appraisal: This is what a planetary liquidation looks like. The Maker was busy here.
Warning: The acid levels of this lake are corrosive to my servomotors.
Testimonial: It is places like this where I most appreciate my lack of olfactory sensors.
Analysis: Whatever this beast was, it has been thoroughly liquidated.
Speculation: If I were a rakghoul, I might make a nest here.
Information: This is the fabled Republic warship "Endar Spire." Fame notwithstanding, it is mostly scrap metal.
Observation: Look, master--another failed Republic effort. They truly never learn, hmm?
Prediction: All Republic undesirables on Taris will be fully liquidated within ten standard weeks.
Anticipation: I can almost smell the undesirables, master. Let's hurry.
Statement: It's some sort of mass transit network that survived destruction. Perhaps we can rectify that.
Praise: The undesirables picked an especially clever hiding spot. All this radiation interferes with my sensors.
